Social network icons

Links to social networks

 Google +
    •

Font Awesome is used to pull in the icons, using the icon stack feature. These icons are best placed in the #ou-site-footer and look good with a <hr> placed above - see bottom of this page for example.

  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • YouTube
  • LinkedIn
  • Google +

You can use this same style with any Font Awesome icon you like, see horizontal icon links for more.

    •

The links provided in the code example are correct - just enter the desired address to replace "ENTER URL HERE". It would be easy to automate the link and use this code as an include throughout your site.

  • Like
  • Tweet
  • +1

Share buttons below heading 1 

This is an example h1

A good position for the share icons is directly underneath the main page heading (h1). If that's what you want to do, add the class "after-h1" to the <ul> element.

This is an example h1
